Reviews.Title: “Castle is more fun than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbandJuliette
Reviews.Content: It's always fun to try something new. My daughter and I choose to stay away from Holiday Inn Express style hotels and to find a more unique place to stay. This Bed and Breakfast Castle is definitely more Unique. The driver arrived at the train station and were wisked away through crazy traffic to the suburbs of Rome. We arrived at the Castle before dark and were greeted by the friendly hostess , Miss Xenia. Their lobby is filled with statues and art and a Christmas tree brightly lit up the area. Miss Xenia was happy to see us and took us up to our spacious accomodation. After visiting with Xenia we walked next door for dinner to a cute little market where they sold fresh hot food and groceries. In the morning we were served a filling Euro breakfast and Xenia was available to help us plan our days journey. We caught a bus in front of a pizzaria around the corner. It took us to the metro to tour all around Rome. Coming back to the Castle each evening was a nice way to end each day away from the roaring crowd of downtown Rome. This unique place to stay made our vacation in Rome truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “the fairy tale castle”
Reviews.Author: ileananina
Reviews.Content: As the title says , we , I mean the whole of us of my family ,felt like living the atmosphere of a childhood fairy tale , because there are plenty of images which took inspiration from fairy tales. And it is, really, a wonder to see the way in which the architecture , the furniture, the statues , the pictures on the walls , the lights ,the carpets , all the objects placed artistically compose a splendid structure,

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: lilian010
Reviews.Content: The best place I ever been in capital!!! BEAUTIFFUL!! Thanks a lot to James and Daniela cause they are recommended this place!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: jelenadoskovic
Reviews.Content: We are a group of friends and like to travel around the world.In this hotel we were very comfortable and pleasant.This is the right place to get to know Rome.Thanks for the wonderful hosts moments during our stay in Rome.For any time of visit to this town, accomodation in this hotel will be the right choice.Me and my friends are looking forward to see you back at these wonderful hosts.

Reviews.Title: “MAMMA MIA BELISSIMO”
Reviews.Author: SavaFinland
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Scandleuzza Castle while visiting Rome. We are a family of 4 and staying in the appartment, it was hugewith 3 beds and large sitting area, beautiful bathroom on lower level, we were served breakfast on the terrace every morning and the room was cleaned with new towels every day. If you go on holiday for new experiences and adventure you will love this hotel.If you travell without car you can get to the center very fast by public tranport.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: nevena276
Reviews.Content: I was with a group in this hotel which was fantastic and very genuine. Portrays the right impression and the smell of Rome. Very comfortable and quick to arrive to the city center, while at the same time you can relax and enjoy the peace while staying at this hotel. I am sorry that I was late October and early November, so I could not use the pool. Therefore, it is covered and open terrace that offers the atmosphere could flight, and very happy mso is used for tanning. For this type of facility provides fantastic opportunities, in its part has a fitness center and hair salon. The hosts were extremely kind and bowed to each guest, so the atmosphere is more than casual and very friendly. Breakfast is diverse and rich, and hygiene in the rooms. Very, very well organized business, as well as the relationship between price and quality service.For guests who have cars, a great relief and a place for parking, which in this hotel you can find safe, because it is located on the territory of the hotel. My friends and I, we have the most beautiful impressions of this hotel, very happy to recommend it, and we hope that we will long be their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but excellent”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld50
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Scandleuzza Castle whilst visiting Rome, dont be put off by the outside appearance of this hotel, we were expecting a beautiful castle in the middle of a field, it isnt. Im not actually convinced that is ever has been a castle and its in a residential area, it looks like several buildings cobbled together, but the owners have obviously spent a considerable amount of time and money on there "castle". We are a family of 4 and staying in the appartment, it was huge!! full length of the building, about 50ft long with 3 beds and large sitting area, beautiful bathroom on lower level, we were served breakfast on the terrace every morning and the room was cleaned with new towels every day. The owners couldnt do enough to help us and were excellent hosts. Pitza restaurant on next street was also very good. If you go on holiday for new experiences and adventure you will love this quirky and different hotel, if you are a fan of the plastic, identical chain hotels then it might not be for you. Only down side is you definately need a car to get into Rome as it is a good way out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Margo230
Reviews.Content: My four friends and I stayed at the Castle for 3 nites and had a wonderful experience. Miss Xenia treated us like honored guests instead of paying customers. Our accommodations were big and comfortable and a very large bathroom!! We had tours scheduled early and arrangements were made to serve us breakfast early and any request was taken care of quickly. Even though a driver was required each day to get back and forth from the center of Rome, it was well worth it to be able to get away from the noise, etc in Rome. If we make it back for another trip, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic and confortable place!”
Reviews.Author: amanda073
Reviews.Content: We were at Scandeluzza Castle few weeks ago and we loved it! It is realy serious place! We travel a lot and usually find expensive and bed-served hotels, but this castle is perfect ! Good service and good prices. After the dinner in Trastevere area It took us just 10 minutes to come back - very quick and easy. The distance is not so far! Staff is very halpful and friendly, especially the Noble family ( Princesse Xenia and Prince Filippo) We stayed one week and met a lot of interesting persons at the Castle. Sunday evening they had a private party in the garden - it was so beautiful - the whole Castle was illuminated by hundred of candles - we were sitting all long the evening and looking that fabiulous backdrop. Openspace jacuzzy is available all day and night , so You can have some special massages whenever You wish. They have Spa , gym - good service and beautiful relaxing place for the guests. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Well over an hour travel time to Rome center via bus and subway”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_7
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend staying at the Scandeluzza Castle for the following reasons: 1. Travel to and from the center of Rome took my family 1.25 - 1.75 hours each way. You have to take a bus from the Castle to the second to last stop on the A subway line. There are at least 10 bus stops between the Castle and where the bus leaves from the subway and it is very difficult to identify the correct stop at night. There is only one restaurant within walking distance of the Castle (though it is good). The Castle's claim that it is "minutes" from the Vatican is extremely misleading unless "75 minutes" is what you had in mind. Thankfully (because I doubt many cab's could ever find the place) we had booked the hotel's "limousine service" (a compact car) to pick us up the train station - even by car it took 1.5 hours because of the great distance and traffic. 2. The service and rooms are at best 3 star. When I asked at check-in for information about making a reservation to visit the Galleria Borghese I was told I could do so myself via telephone (no offer of the number). When my follow-up question was whether the room had a telephone I was informed that the Castle was a B&B and did not offer "hotel services." The breakfast part of the "B&B" was also lacking - beverages, cereal (though the milk was out and no staff could be located to replenish it) and pre-packaged pastries. But they were willing to set us up with their driver to take us to the airport (a 20 minute ride without traffic - we left early in the morning) for 59 Euros. 3. The room was much smaller than it appeared on the website. Only a small bar of hand soap was provided, and towels could only be changed every two days without charge. The shower was very small (and cheap) and there was nowhere to place your belongings in the bathroom. We had the further bad luck of our room being located near a machine that noisily turned on and off every couple of minutes. 4. The Castle itself was interesting and attractive enough, though only two rooms are open to the public and it isn't possible to spend much time in them as the lighting is inadequate after dark. There is a no garden area, only a tiled courtyard. Also, note that it would never have occurred to me to describe this remotely located B&B as a "castle."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful family owned property!”
Reviews.Author: Chirop
Reviews.Content: Although on the outskirts of Rome, we found this hidden "gem" to be a nice retreat and relief to return to from the crowds and noise of the city. Taxi fare to centre of Rome for our family of 5 was about 20Euro each way and took 20 - 30 minutes. We stayed in the Madonne and Pelligrini suites - both very spacious, filled with antiques, tapestries, etc.. Breakfast included coffee, milk, juices, cold cereals, toast, pastries, and fruit. Quiet location - only things within walking distance were a restaurant across the road (good food, cheap prices) and a grocery market a few steps away. Friendly family owned. Only Xenia (hostess) was able to speak English. Overall very impressed with the property. We were glad we did not stay in a tiny, noisy hotel room in downtown Rome! On the other hand there are no nearby cafe's or bars to enjoy in the evening. Instead we had our own "beverages" we purchased and enjoyed sitting in the beautiful castle courtyard visiting with the few other guests. Would definetely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: fino8
Reviews.Content: Just back from our honeymoon all around Europe which started with our Wedding in Rome. We were about 2 or 3 months debating with ourselves and Xenia wether or not we were going to have our Wedding reception in the castle as its a big decision we were quite doubtful. We eventually went ahead and booked it and on our arrival we were quite worried about our choice!! The taxi drops you in what I can only describe as a laneway and they say 1st impressions last but in the case of the castle they didnt!! Once we entered the big gates it was like a different part of the world ,we were greeted by Xenia and the grandmother Lilliane and made feel very welcome. The kindness and professionalism of the staff at Scandeluzza cannot be faulted our wedding and stay at the Castle went without a hitch. The food was a delight that we and our guests will remember for a long long time. Overall the Castle staff went out of their way to make our day a truely rememorable and special day for both of us and we would like to say Thank You from the bottom of our hearts, Anthony and Renee. P.S. ill send the Irish flag to you soon Phillipo its the least I can do,ty

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmich929
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (Self, wife, son aged 17 and son aged 2) toured Europe for a month. We stayed 6 days in Rome @ the Scandeluzza Castle. As you can tell by other reviews, it seems one either hates it or loves it - WE LOVED IT! Often, travelers from the West (espec. N. American Continent) are "finicky" or "fussy" about silly little things. We wanted to experience "true life" while traveling and we were able to gain that by staying at Scandeluzza Castle. Upon our arrival (via pre-arranged car/driver booked thru same agent that booked us for castle), we discovered that electricity service is not dependable in Rome! LOL I felt bad for Xenia as she seemed soooo embarrassed, but we laughed it off and the power was back on in 20 mins. We had originally booked the Xenia suite, but the Prince insisted that we instead choose from that or any of the other available rooms, so we instead chose the Pelligrini Suite, allowing for much more room for a family of 4 with two separate private areas. The suite was LARGE, by any standards, but especially so by European standards! No sooner were we assisted with our luggage up to the 3rd flr. (no lift here, but worked fine for us - just make a note of it if you have trouble with stairs), we were handed our key and reminded that beds were made daily, but towels and linens would be changed every 2 days (unless requested prior). We unpacked a bit and as it was 2PM, the wife and I thought we'd scoot into Rome and get some Euros from ATM as we were running low. The boys stayed behind and rested. Prince Fillipo had provided our 2 yr. old several small, antique cars/trucks, etc...to play with. The very toys he played with himself as a child, and his Mother, the Princess, had a tear in her eye watching our son play with them, as she said he reminded her so much of her own son years ago. It was a touching moment. We were supplied, free of charge, with tickets for bus into town/subway (yes, it is 4 miles!!! So plan on transportation time, if you know Rome, this can be a long time). We caught the bus to town, but on the wrong side of the street! So, instead of going into town, we went out of it and around it and thru it and any other way you can imagine......it was 2 hours well spent to see so much of the Lazio countryside and outskirts of Rome - and for free! Upon our return 4-5 hours later, we were all tired from travel from Paris earlier in day and hungry for dinner. At 7:30, we ventured over to the small restaurant across the side street from Scandeluzza, as highly recommended by Ms. Xenia. It's called "Papi Pizza" and is our new favorite restaurant in the world!! I fed a family of 4, each a 3 course dinner, including wine, 2 cocktails for me, AND deserts (not to mention including the most awesome anti-pasta bar ever!) - all for $50 U.S.!!! Unheard of anywhere in Europe! For the next 6 days while in Rome, we ate at Papi Pizza at least 1x per day, sometimes 2 if we happenned to be around for lunch AND dinner hours. To be honest, Scandeluzza Castle and Papi Pizza are reason enough to return to Rome in and of themselves! On our 3rd day in Rome, we foolishly divided up 2 of our credit cards, letting my older son of 17 keep one in his wallet which he kept in his front pocket guarded at all times with his hand on it. At all times that is, except for when being shoved aside in the subway during rush-hour, of course it was promptly stolen. After filing reports with police & credit card cos., we returned to Scandeluzza Castle feeling kind of "down and out". The day before, the Prince and Princess themselves had invited us to a private function for that evening - it was to be a knighting ceremony! We decided to dress appropriately and go as planned instead of moping about our earlier pick-pocket experience on Subway. Upon our arrival into the Great Hall (wife on my arm as we slowly descended the stairs), we felt (and were treated) like royalty! We were just a bit "fashionably late". There were well over 100 people seated. Gentlemen stood to greet my wife and the typical European "shmoozing" began, as though WE WERE THE ROYALS in the room! The Prince performed some toasts of some sort in Italian and we were seated by white gloved attendants. I couldn't believe what happenned next as his Mother, the Princess herself, came to my side with a FULL LEG OF LAMB! She explained in very limited English that she cooked it herself and then set it in front of me and said "....eat, eat - for you....I do for you!" I only thought of how gluttonous I must've looked! The food, the knighting ceremony of a wealthy businessman from town, the wine from Prince Fillipo's private vineyard, the music, etc... was all AWESOME and made for an unforgettable evening! My wife ended up dancing with Embassadors, Lords, Dignitaries, etc.. for most of the evening and we no doubt felt very "Regal" - hehe. It was a night to remember, one we'll treasure forever! The next night we had purchased food "to go" from Papi Pizza next door, for our sons, as we had made exclusive dinner plans ahead of time alone at the Scandeluzza Castle (they will provide private dinner for 2 at 100 Euro). It was veal with all the appropriate side dishes and presented to us by the Miss Xenia. Although it was well prepared, presented and delicious, I would've chosen Papi-Pizza instead, but didn't want to be rude and cancel reservation @ Scandeluzza Castle. We had the run of the castle that evening! Also, several times thru-out our stay, the Prince would "entice" us with a bit of his private stock of wine or other Italian "beverages", it made for a warm and welcoming atmosphere. His mother, the Princess Pelligrino, took my hand once as we were on our way to tour Rome one morning, and she guided me to her husbands private burial chapel on the grounds of Scandeluzza Castle. Although she spoke little to no English, and I the same of Italian, we "spoke" for over an hour and shared something special that day. Several mornings we were provided with a ride to the subway free of charge. On one morning in particular, the Prince and his mother took us, but stopped on the way at a large, local groceria and then took us out for capuccinos and mid-morning "treats". The Prince, his family and staff all took fondly to our sons and treated them with kindness and affection. We will DEFINITELY return to Scandeluzza Castle and Papi Pizza again - unfortunately, it just won't be soon enough! Mark and Yvette Michaud, Boston, MA USA

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel but too many faults”
Reviews.Author: ryan2801
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the awful Ciampino Airport we decided to get a taxi to the Scandeluzza Castle, only to find that none of the taxi drivers had heard of it and the cheapest fare we got was 90 Euros. The so called castle is miles from Rome city center in the middle of no where On arrival we were greeted by a pleasant lady who showed us our room, The Pellegrini Suite, which was about five flights of stares upwards. How we laughed at the hotel's advert that this suite was 100 square meters. Maybe if you walked around it 10 times. It was very clean however but the bathroom was ludicrously tiny. If you are a large person don't even think about trying to sit on the toilet, it really is that cramped. After arrival we went to the "reception" to see if we could get a hot drink but no one was there. In the morning we were told that it is only a B&B so do not expect any service after 8pm. The castle itself is stunning, and the decor inside truly remarkable. However there is absolutely nothing to do there. No bar, and the so called jacuzzi was in fact a pile of rubble covered in a plastic sheet with building work next to it. To get to Rome wasn't too much of a problem, a bus stop is just down the road which will take you to the nearest Metro and takes about 20 minutes I would not recommend this hotel due to its remote location and nothing at all to do there at all.

Reviews.Title: “go there!!”
Reviews.Author: mkrob
Reviews.Content: we were ther for 6 days and we had wonderful time!my family simply loved it!the castle is so spacious, our room was full of lights and allways kept clean!the service was exellent.those people are so nice and sweet!my kids still talk about the staff how they played with them while my wife and i were relaxing in the jacuzzi.after the confusion that one can find in rome this place is so peaceful and quiet that one feels like a brend new for further quests of rome.it is like 3,5 miles from the historical center but in their transport you can be in the heart of rome in 10-15min! The breakfast was typical italian with bunch of cornetti and the greatest coffee that we have ever tasted.we are definitivly comming back!

Reviews.Title: “go there you won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: robert.troll
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family, my wife and 3 kids. the entrance to the castle was magnificant, our room was acctualy an enormus apartment with colored windows which gave different rainbow like lights. the bathroom was spacious with large tub which was not neccesary since you can use a jacuzzi for a very reasonable price. for the structure that is ONLY B&B their service is more than a 4 stars hotel!everybody was so kind and nice to us, and played with our kids, giving them small gifts etc. it is true that the roman public transport sucks, but since one goes to the vacation, one can afford the service that not all B&B provides, which is renting a car with personal driver who speaks your language(the difference from taxi drivers that do not speak any of english) plus gives you all info needed for knowing rome better than one can from all guide book. We like to travel a lot and this is one of the places that we would recommend for so many reasons. having 3 kids you can immagine how 'difficult' they can get and here we have found so patience for our loud family. breakfas was tipical continental(coffee, milk, various types of tea, 5 kinds of 'marmelata', corn flakes any different delicious cookes, 7 kinds of yogurt etc.), which beeing in italy is normal! those 'bauli' cornetti with cream chocolate my kids will never forget! Iwe can't wait to come back there again since we were took as their oun family! go there you won't regreat it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible access to the tourist sites of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As noted by others, while the castle is touted as being just "3 miles from the Vatican" public transport time from the castle to the sites of Rome across the river (where most tourist sites are located) was close to 2 hours each way as the bus to and from the Metro was extremely slow and erratic. The trip to the Vatican took about 1 hour and 20 minutes. You do not want to stay here if you intend to go into town each day or if you have small children. Also, the place is pretty strange. The castle is actually a "bed and breakfast" and it certainly does not look like a castle. This place is in the suburbs and while there is a grocery store and a restaurant within a few blocks the nearest small town is at least 1 mile away, accessible only by walking directly in a narrow road while cars dash by (no sidewalks and good luck on catching the bus to the town). The "castle" does not have any grounds to speak of, so no walking in a beautiful park or garden. The rooms are large compared to most hotels in Rome but there are no services provided without extra charge. The breakfast did indeed include prepackaged and terrible croissants - so unusual for Italy. To sum it up - seems little point in coming to Rome and staying at a place where it is so difficult and so expensive to get access to transportation that it becomes very hard to see the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “My family will always remember the castle!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is superb!Great hospitality!Very romantic place!There is something special and unic! Visit it!Scandeluzza Castle is absolutley amazing! Tom&Jerry!

Reviews.Title: “Issues with Scandeluzza”
Reviews.Author: DanfromSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Rome highlights are up to 2 hours each way on public transportation. Dogs barked and roosters crowed ALL NIGHT throughout the neighborhood all 3 nights. "Continental breakfast on fine antique china" is a store-packaged piece of yellow bread shaped like a croissant with preservatives. Hot water for bathing was brief, rare, unpredicatable. The place is funky-bohemian, which is fun. People were friendly and mostly helpful. One sleeping area in our Pelligrini suite was alot quieter than the other - be careful in room selection.

Reviews.Title: “We would like to stay in this castle again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Castle was great, it made me feel like a princess! Xenia was very very very friendlyto us. I would deffenetly stay here again. It's beautiful and neat. We will twll everyone of our friends to stay here. I LOVE IT! Rome is a beautiful city. I LOVE it. Thanks so much! Love from Madeline, Chris, Liz, Christopher.

Reviews.Title: “Scandeluzza Castle is the best place I have ever been!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The castle is magnificant and we are leaving here with many fond memories! The prince Filippo and his staff are very welcoming, friendly and very helpful. I would recommend to everyone to visit it! Wonderful accomodation!

HotelInfo.Name: Scandeluzza Castle - Castello Scandeluzza
HotelInfo.Address: Via Scandeluzza, 11, 00100 Rome, Italy
